response.overview: Downstairs House is a short documentary that documents the life of an elderly couple over the course of three years. With a single camera, the director visits the house regularly and participates in their daily activities. "But life has rolls" says the protagonist in the second part of the film, and since nothing is a product of direction, everything moves freely and unexpectedly, the documentary reaches a quagmire that is none other than the vulnerability of our human nature.
response.title: The other house
